DOC.detailed_description: Participants separate opioid-experienced opioid-naïve group . Participants group randomly allocate 3:1 ratio receive fentanyl sublingual spray ( FSS ) match placebo sublingual spray ( PSS ) 10 minute schedule procedure . Based FDA guideline , opioid-experienced FSS participant receive FSS 400 µg , opioid-naïve FSS participant randomize 1:1 ratio receive either 100 µg 200 µg . All participant randomize placebo receive match PSS , regardless opioid experience . Pain sedation record multiple time schedule procedure . If rescue medication need procedure , local anesthetic standard care procedure administer record study record . Efficacy safety/tolerability fentanyl sublingual spray evaluate among treatment group .
